en:
White Nike (with frontal blue wings) flying 3/4-view to the right,
      wearing a white (or colored) chiton, a himation billowing at her side (?), a red taenia, a
      high pony tail, bead earrings, and a beaded necklace, reaches her arms out to Athena; white
      Athena, seated 3/4-view to the left, with her head profile to the right, tilted back, wearing
      a red, sleeveless chiton, a white himation, a Corinthian helmet, a beaded necklace, and two
      red bands on each wrist, rests her bent left arm on her shield, and holds upright in her right
      hand a scepter with a gold tip; Herakles, standing near frontal, with his weight on his left
      leg, his right leg relaxed, and his head profile to the left, wearing a himation over his
      back/left arm, and his lion's-head helmet, rests the back of his left hand on his hip, and
      holds his club under his right arm; Dionysos, seated or standing 3/4-view to the left, wearing
      a short-sleeved oriental tunic over a long-sleeved oriental tunic, and an ivy wreath, holds a
      thyrsos (with a snake around its lower part ) upright in his right hand; Demeter, seated
      3/4-view to the left, with her head 3/4-view to the right, wearing a short-sleeved chiton, a
      gold crown, and one gold bracelet on each wrist, holds her scepter in her upraised right hand,
      and holds her left hand in front of her body; small, white Ploutos, standing 3/4-view to the
      left, wearing a red oriental tunic, a blue himation on his back, and a red taenia, holds in
      both hands, to the right, an empty red keras with a gold rim; indistinct red objects fall on
      the ground beneath the keras; white Kore, standing nearly frontal, with her head 3/4-view to
      the left, wearing a white chiton, a blue himation, a gold taenia, a gold necklace, and two
      bracelets on her right wrist, raises a torch in each hand; Eumolpos, seated 3/4-view to the
      left, with his head profile to the right, wearing a long oriental tunic, rests his right hand
      on knee, and rests a gold scepter on his left shoulder; one Dioskouros on horseback, riding
      3/4-view to the left (only the white head of the horse, and the head of the Dioskouros are
      evident); Iakchos, standing 3/4-view to the right, holds a torch to the right in his left hand
      (only the top half of his head and the top half of his torch are preserved); a second
      Dioskouros on a rearing horse, riding near profile to the left, enveloped in a chlamys. Behind
      him lie three boukrania on the ground (the center one has gold on the
      horns).

<bibl>Simon 1997</bibl>, 102-103, fig. 10;
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 7.417 s.v. Ploutos no. 8 (K. Clinton); <bibl>Clinton
      1992</bibl>, 69, 75, 82, 84, 93, 113 no. 6, fig. 30; <bibl>Add2</bibl>, 381;
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 4.45 s.v. Eubouleus no. 14 (G. Schwarz), 57 s.v. Eumolpos no.
      10 (L. Weidauer), 878 s.v. Demeter no. 407 (L. Beschi), 806 s.v. Herakles no. 1408, pl. 536
      (J. Boardman et al.); <bibl>Schwarz 1987</bibl>, V 131;
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 3.581 s.v. Dioskouroi no. 170 (A. Hermary); E. Bhr, CVA Tbingen
      4 (1984) 107-10, pls. 50.1, 51, fig. 39 (with previous bibliography);
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 2.997 s.v. Athena no. 457 (P. Demargne); <bibl>Hamdorf
      1964</bibl> 108 no. 403d; <bibl>Beazley 1941</bibl>, 6
